title: Fed's Clarida Says World's Government Bond Markets Are Increasingly Integrated
sub_head: The central bank vice chairman flagged research that contends U.S. economic and policy events are a strong driver of bond yields around the globe
body:
Federal Reserve Vice-Chairman Richard Clarida said Monday the national bond markets that central banks rely on to transmit monetary policy changes to their respective economies are highly subject to international forces beyond the control of those institutions.
That global integration affects how central banks need to approach their policy choices, the official said in a speech text, he said.
